extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.FetchElasticsearch5
extension.description: Retrieves a document from Elasticsearch using the specified connection properties and the identifier of the document to retrieve. If the cluster has been configured for authorization and/or secure transport (SSL/TLS), and the X-Pack plugin is available, secure connections can be made. This processor supports Elasticsearch 5.x clusters.

property.name: el5-cluster-name
property.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'

property.name: el5-hosts
property.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300. This processor uses the Transport Client to connect to hosts. The default transport client port is 9300.

property.name: el5-ssl-context-service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: el5-xpack-location
property.description: Specifies the path to the JAR(s) for the Elasticsearch X-Pack Transport feature. If the Elasticsearch cluster has been secured with the X-Pack plugin, then the X-Pack Transport JARs must also be available to this processor. Note: Do NOT place the X-Pack JARs into NiFi's lib/ directory, doing so will prevent the X-Pack Transport JARs from being loaded.

property.name: el5-username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-ping-timeout
property.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s

property.name: el5-sampler-interval
property.description: How often to sample / ping the nodes listed and connected. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s.

property.name: el5-fetch-doc-id
property.description: The identifier for the document to be fetched

property.name: el5-fetch-index
property.description: The name of the index to read from

property.name: el5-fetch-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: el5-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be fetched but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be read from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the specified document does not exist in the Elasticsearch cluster

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attributes is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.DeleteElasticsearch5
extension.description: Delete a document from Elasticsearch 5.0 by document id. If the cluster has been configured for authorization and/or secure transport (SSL/TLS), and the X-Pack plugin is available, secure connections can be made.

property.name: el5-cluster-name
property.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'

property.name: el5-hosts
property.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300. This processor uses the Transport Client to connect to hosts. The default transport client port is 9300.

property.name: el5-ssl-context-service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: el5-xpack-location
property.description: Specifies the path to the JAR(s) for the Elasticsearch X-Pack Transport feature. If the Elasticsearch cluster has been secured with the X-Pack plugin, then the X-Pack Transport JARs must also be available to this processor. Note: Do NOT place the X-Pack JARs into NiFi's lib/ directory, doing so will prevent the X-Pack Transport JARs from being loaded.

property.name: el5-username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-ping-timeout
property.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s

property.name: el5-sampler-interval
property.description: How often to sample / ping the nodes listed and connected. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s.

property.name: el5-delete-document-id
property.description: The identifier for the document to be deleted

property.name: el5-delete-index
property.description: The name of the index to delete the document from

property.name: el5-delete-type
property.description: The type of this document to be deleted

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the document cannot be deleted because or retryable exception like timeout or node not available

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFile corresponding to the deleted document from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFile corresponding to delete document that failed from Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the specified document was not found in elasticsearch

writesAttribute.name: es.error.message
writesAttribute.description: The message attribute in case of error

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename attribute which is set to the document identifier

writesAttribute.name: es.index
writesAttribute.description: The Elasticsearch index containing the document

writesAttribute.name: es.rest.status
writesAttribute.description: The filename attribute with rest status

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.elasticsearch.PutElasticsearch5
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile to Elasticsearch, using the specified parameters such as the index to insert into and the type of the document. If the cluster has been configured for authorization and/or secure transport (SSL/TLS), and the X-Pack plugin is available, secure connections can be made. This processor supports Elasticsearch 5.x clusters.

property.name: el5-cluster-name
property.description: Name of the ES cluster (for example, elasticsearch_brew). Defaults to 'elasticsearch'

property.name: el5-hosts
property.description: ElasticSearch Hosts, which should be comma separated and colon for hostname/port host1:port,host2:port,.... For example testcluster:9300. This processor uses the Transport Client to connect to hosts. The default transport client port is 9300.

property.name: el5-ssl-context-service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections. This service only applies if the Elasticsearch endpoint(s) have been secured with TLS/SSL.

property.name: el5-xpack-location
property.description: Specifies the path to the JAR(s) for the Elasticsearch X-Pack Transport feature. If the Elasticsearch cluster has been secured with the X-Pack plugin, then the X-Pack Transport JARs must also be available to this processor. Note: Do NOT place the X-Pack JARs into NiFi's lib/ directory, doing so will prevent the X-Pack Transport JARs from being loaded.

property.name: el5-username
property.description: Username to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-password
property.description: Password to access the Elasticsearch cluster

property.name: el5-ping-timeout
property.description: The ping timeout used to determine when a node is unreachable. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s

property.name: el5-sampler-interval
property.description: How often to sample / ping the nodes listed and connected. For example, 5s (5 seconds). If non-local recommended is 30s.

property.name: el5-put-id-attribute
property.description: The name of the attribute containing the identifier for each FlowFile

property.name: el5-put-index
property.description: The name of the index to insert into

property.name: el5-put-type
property.description: The type of this document (used by Elasticsearch for indexing and searching)

property.name: el5-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: el5-put-batch-size
property.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction

property.name: el5-put-index-op
property.description: The type of the operation used to index (index, update, upsert)

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if the database cannot be updated but attempting the operation again may succeed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to Elasticsearch are routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.
